Title: 1. Ben-Hur
description: A Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend in 1st-century Jerusalem, but it's not long before he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

Title: 2. Sleeping Beauty
description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

Title: 3. The World of Apu
description: This final installment in Satyajit Ray's Apu Trilogy follows Apu's life as an orphaned adult aspiring to be a writer.

Title: 4. Hiroshima Mon Amour
description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

Title: 5. North by Northwest
description: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.

Title: 6. The Law
description: Illicit passions pervade an Italian town, where men gather nightly for the cynical "game of the law."

Title: 7. The Indian Tomb
description: A German architect runs away with the maharajah of Eschnapur's fiancee but is caught and thrown in the dungeon, while his relatives arrive from Europe looking for him and the maharajah's brother is scheming to usurp the throne.

Title: 8. The Tiger of Eschnapur
description: In Eschnapur, a local Maharajah and a German architect fall in-love with the same temple dancer.

Title: 9. The 400 Blows
description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

Title: 10. Darby O'Gill and the Little People
description: A wily old codger matches wits with the King of the Leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

Title: 11. Some Like It Hot
description: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

Title: 12. The World, the Flesh and the Devil
description: A miner trapped in a cave-in resurfaces, and upon discovering mankind has been wiped out in a nuclear holocaust, sets out to find other survivors.

Title: 13. Rio Bravo
description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a disabled man, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

Title: 14. Anatomy of a Murder
description: An upstate Michigan lawyer defends a soldier who claims he killed an innkeeper due to temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

Title: 15. On the Beach
description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

Title: 16. Journey to the Center of the Earth
description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

Title: 17. The Mouse That Roared
description: A tiny, impoverished European nation declares war on the United States of America, planning to lose in order to collect post-war compensation, but things don't go according to plan.

Title: 18. Imitation of Life
description: An aspiring white actress takes in an African American widow whose mixed-race daughter is desperate to be seen as white.

Title: 19. Suddenly, Last Summer
description: A surgeon is assigned the case of a young woman whose aunt wants her lobotomized to cover up a family secret.

Title: 20. The Shaggy Dog
description: A teenage boy is cursed with periodically turning into a sheepdog.

Title: 21. Pillow Talk
description: An interior decorator and a playboy songwriter share a telephone party line and size each other up.

Title: 22. House on Haunted Hill
description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

Title: 23. Operation Petticoat
description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

Title: 24. The Best of Everything
description: An expose of the lives and loves of Madison Avenue working girls and their higher ups.

Title: 25. Edge of Eternity
description: In the 1950s, Arizona Deputy Sheriff Les Martin is pressured by his community to solve a string of mysterious murders around a mining ghost town in the Grand Canyon.

Title: 26. The Human Condition I: No Greater Love
description: A Japanese pacifist, unable to face the dire consequences of conscientious objection, is transformed by his attempts to compromise with the demands of war-time Japan.

Title: 27. The Diary of Anne Frank
description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

Title: 28. The Horse Soldiers
description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

Title: 29. Solomon and Sheba
description: After becoming king of ancient Israel, Solomon faces threats coming from his jealous dispossessed brother Adonijah, the Egyptian Pharaoh and the scheming Queen of Sheba.

Title: 30. A Summer Place
description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

Title: 31. Serious Charge
description: A vicar falsely accused of assaulting a youth attempts to prove his innocence and save his reputation.

Title: 32. Gidget
description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

Title: 33. The Hound of the Baskervilles
description: When a nobleman is threatened by a family curse on his newly inherited estate, detective Sherlock Holmes is hired to investigate.

Title: 34. Black Orpheus
description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the time of the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

Title: 35. Li'l Abner
description: As Sadie Hawkins Day approaches, Daisy Mae hopes to win the hand of Li'l Abner by catching him in the traditional race.

Title: 36. Pickpocket
description: Michel passes the time by picking pockets, careful to never be caught despite being watched by the police. His friend Jacques may suspect, while both men may have their eyes on Jeanne, the pretty neighbor of Michel's ailing mother.

Title: 37. Yesterday's Enemy
description: In World War II, during the Japanese invasion of Burma, the lost remnant of a British Army Brigade HQ, led by the ruthless Captain Alan Langford, escapes through the jungle toward the British lines.

Title: 38. King of the Wild Stallions
description: A young widow and her son on an isolated ranch find themselves being protected by a wild stallion.

Title: 39. The Nun's Story
description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

Title: 40. Compulsion
description: Two wealthy law-school students go on trial for murder in this version of the Leopold-Loeb case.

Title: 41. Attack of the Giant Leeches
description: A backwoods game warden and a local doctor discover that giant leeches are responsible for disappearances and deaths in a local swamp, but the local police don't believe them.

Title: 42. Odds Against Tomorrow
description: In need of quick money, a fallen former cop recruits a hard-bitten ex-con and a debt-ridden nightclub singer to pull off a bank job. But as the animosity between them boils over, the entire plan threatens to implode.

Title: 43. Ride Lonesome
description: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to be tried for murder, with the killer's brother after them.

Title: 44. Warlock
description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

Title: 45. The Mummy
description: In 1895, British archaeologists find and open the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka with nefarious consequences.

Title: 46. Day of the Outlaw
description: Blaise Starrett is a rancher at odds with homesteaders when outlaws hold up the small town. The outlaws are held in check only by their notorious leader, but he is diagnosed with a fatal wound and the town is a powder keg waiting to blow.

Title: 47. I Spit on Your Grave
description: After the lynching death of his black brother in Memphis, a light-skinned African-American, heads to a small Southern town, where he draws the attention of a heiress, and learns that the place is as racist as his hometown.

Title: 48. A Bucket of Blood
description: A dimwitted busboy at a beatnik cafe passes off a cat he accidentally killed and covered in plaster as a sculpture, prompting a demand for more art that compels him to commit murders.

Title: 49. Our Man in Havana
description: Expatriate vacuum cleaner salesman Jim Wormold agrees to work as an agent, and to recruit new agents, for the British Secret Service in Cuba, but he soon realizes that his deceptive ways are going to get him in trouble.

Title: 50. The 39 Steps
description: In London, a diplomat accidentally becomes involved in the death of a British agent who's after a spy ring that covets British military secrets.

Title: 51. Escort West
description: An ex-Confederate officer and his young daughter, traveling West, rescue two women survivors of an Indian attack.

Title: 52. The Bat
description: A crazed killer known as "The Bat" is on the loose in a mansion full of people.

Title: 53. Good Morning
description: Two boys begin a silence strike to press their parents into buying them a television set.

Title: 54. The Tingler
description: An obsessed pathologist discovers and captures a parasitic creature that grows when fear grips its host.

Title: 55. The Wasp Woman
description: The head of a major cosmetics company experiments on herself with a youth formula made from royal jelly extracted from wasps, but the formula's side effects have deadly consequences.

Title: 56. The Gunfight at Dodge City
description: After his brother the sheriff is murdered, Bat Masterson is elected to the job and is determined to find the killer and make Dodge City safe.

Title: 57. The Wild and the Innocent
description: In Wyoming, mountain trapper Yancey goes to the nearest town to trade his pelts but gets into trouble when he tries to save runaway dance-hall girl Rosalie from her shameful job.

Title: 58. Mr. Tease and His Playthings
description: A door to door salesman of dentist's appliances encounters beautiful well-endowed nude women everywhere he goes.

Title: 59. The Great Van Robbery
description: Interpol detective Caesar Smith tracks robbers of the Royal Mint van. He travels to Rio de Janeiro, Rome and Paris and establishes the guilt of a London coffee importer.

Title: 60. North West Frontier
description: Set on the North West Frontier of colonial India in 1905. A British Army Officer, Captain Scott is sent to rescue a five year old Indian Prince and his American governess, Catherine Wyatt from certain death at the hands of rebel tribesman.

Title: 61. The Hanging Tree
description: Unusual western about a doctor with a dark past, whose life is complicated and ultimately redeemed by a young thief, and a pretty Swiss immigrant whom he nurses back to health.

Title: 62. Teenagers from Outer Space
description: A young alien and a teenage earthling fall in love and plot to stop the alien race from using Earth as a food-breeding ground for giant lobsters from their planet.

Title: 63. Porgy and Bess
description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly - if only everyone else would allow them to.

Title: 64. Pork Chop Hill
description: During the Korean War peace talks in Panmunjom, U.S. troops fight and die trying to retake a worthless hill from the Communist Chinese forces.

Title: 65. Never So Few
description: During WW2, the American OSS mounts covert operations with the native Kachin against the Japanese army in the jungles of Burma.

Title: 66. Tiger Bay
description: A twelve-year-old tomboy witnesses the murder of a woman by her Polish merchant marine boyfriend, but bonds with him and thwarts the police in their investigation.

Title: 67. Green Mansions
description: A young man in the jungles of Venezuela meets a strange girl of the forest and falls in love with her.

Title: 68. Floating Weeds
description: The head of a Japanese theatre troupe returns to a small coastal town where he left a son who thinks he is his uncle, and tries to make up for the lost time, but his current mistress grows jealous.

Title: 69. It Happened to Jane
description: Jane Osgood runs a lobster business, which supports her two young children. Railroad staff inattention ruins her shipment, so with her lawyer George, Jane sues Harry Foster Malone, director of the line and the "meanest man in the world".

Title: 70. The Devil's Disciple
description: The black sheep of a family and the local minister discover their true vocations during the Revolutionary War.

Title: 71. They Came to Cordura
description: An army major, himself guilty of cowardice, is asked to recommend soldiers for the Congressional Medal of Honor during the Mexican Border Incursion of 1916.

Title: 72. Carry on Nurse
description: An idiosyncratic group of patients wreak havoc in the men's surgical ward of Haven Hospital. They decide to take their revenge on the frosty Matron, and there is even a spot of DIY surgery!

Title: 73. Caltiki, the Immortal Monster
description: A team of archaeologists in Mexico encounter an amorphous, blob-like monster that appears to be connected with the collapse of the Mayan civilization.

Title: 74. The Young Philadelphians
description: A promising lawyer tries to handle his social and professional problems while climbing the ranks in Philadelphia.

Title: 75. Face of a Fugitive
description: A robber who is falsely accused of murdering a deputy sheriff tries to start a new life in a border town near Mexico, but his past catches up with him.

Title: 76. Sapphire
description: The murder of a young woman in London exposes deep racial tensions and prejudices inherent in the area.

Title: 77. Middle of the Night
description: A widowed businessman becomes obsessed with one of his employees, the divorc√©e Betty Preisser.

Title: 78. A Hole in the Head
description: Widower Tony is trying to keep a small Miami hotel afloat while raising a 12-year-old son. He's forced to ask his harried brother Mario for help, but he'll only bail Tony out if he quits his bohemian lifestyle and marries a sensible woman.

Title: 79. Battle of the Coral Sea
description: In 1942 submarine commander Jeff Conway secretly photographs Japanese aircraft carriers in the Coral Sea but his submarine is damaged and he's forced to surrender.

Title: 80. The Beat Generation
description: A detective is assigned to track down and capture a crazed serial rapist.

Title: 81. The Human Condition II: Road to Eternity
description: As a conscript in war-time Japan's military, a pacifist struggles to maintain his determination to keep his ideals.

Title: 82. Ballad of a Soldier
description: Young Russian soldier Alyosha earns a medal, but asks to visit his mother instead. His journey recounts various kinds of love during wartime.

Title: 83. The Killer Shrews
description: On an isolated island, a small group of people is terrorized by giant voracious shrews during a hurricane.

Title: 84. The Wreck of the Mary Deare
description: A disgraced merchant marine officer elects to stay aboard his sinking cargo ship in order to prove the vessel was deliberately scuttled and, as a result, vindicate his good name.

Title: 85. I'm All Right Jack
description: A naive aristocrat in search of a career becomes caught up in the struggles between his profit-minded uncle and an aggressive labor union.

Title: 86. The Dead Man's Treasure
description: Theoni finds a strange way to gain some money, in order to pay her bills , by renting rooms in her rickety house.

Title: 87. Alias Jesse James
description: Outlaw T.J. "Jesse" James tries to kill insurance agent Milford Farnsworth, who's been mistaken for Jesse, in order to collect on a $100,000 life insurance policy.

Title: 88. Last Train from Gun Hill
description: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend, an autocratic cattle baron, to justice for his role in the rape and murder of the marshal's Native American wife.

Title: 89. Tarzan's Greatest Adventure
description: Four British villains raid a settlement to obtain explosives for use in a diamond mine. In doing so they nearly destroy the settlement, so and Tarzan pursues them to their mine.

Title: 90. The Atomic Submarine
description: Ships mysteriously disappear on route across the Arctic Sea, and a specially-equipped submarine is sent to investigate.

Title: 91. The Giant Gila Monster
description: A giant lizard terrorizes a rural Texas community and a heroic teenager attempts to destroy the creature.

Title: 92. No Name on the Bullet
description: Townsfolk know a gunman's going to kill someone, but they don't know who it will be.

Title: 93. Beast from Haunted Cave
description: A group of gold thieves pull of a heist and flee into the snowy wilderness, only to be pursued by a horrible, spider-like monster.

Title: 94. Shake Hands with the Devil
description: In 1920s Ireland, I.R.A. members are being led by the war mongering Dr. Sean Lenihan (James Cagney), as they fight oppressive British forces.

Title: 95. Look Back in Anger
description: A disillusioned, angry university graduate comes to terms with his grudge against middle-class life and values.

Title: 96. Third Man on the Mountain
description: A boy attempts to realize his father's dream of climbing an alpine peak known as the Citadel.

Title: 97. Odd Obsession
description: A man getting on in years sets out to find a way to resurrect his flagging virility.

Title: 98. Return of the Fly
description: Philippe Delambre, the now-adult son of "The Fly", does some transportation experimentation of his own.

Title: 99. The Alligator People
description: A woman in a hypnotic state recounts to two doctors the details of a horrific experience from her past life that began with the mysterious and sudden disappearance of her husband.

Title: 100. The Bridge
description: In 1945, Germany is being overrun, and nobody is left to fight but teenagers.

Title: 101. Al Capone
description: A chronicle of the rise and fall of Chicago crime boss Al Capone during the Prohibition era.

Title: 102. The Day the Earth Froze
description: The evil witch Louhi kidnaps Lemmink√§inen's sister to build for her a Sampo, a device that creates salt, grain, and gold. When Lemmink√§inen fails to recover the Sampo, Louhi steals the sun, plunging the world into frozen darkness.

Title: 103. The Wonderful Country
description: A honorable drifter constantly on the run finds his enemies closing in around him.

Title: 104. Battle in Outer Space
description: The nations of the Earth unite in a common cause to fight off an invader from outer space.

Title: 105. The Giant Behemoth
description: Marine atomic tests cause changes in the ocean's ecosystem resulting in dangerous blobs of radiation and the resurrection of a dormant dinosaur that threatens London.

Title: 106. The Angry Red Planet
description: One of only two survivors from a Martian expedition is so traumatized she doesn't remember the circumstances of the trip.

Title: 107. Up Periscope
description: In 1942, Navy Lieutenant Kenneth Braden from the underwater demolition team is sent to a Japanese island to photograph secret radio codes.

Title: 108. Beloved Infidel
description: Toward the end of his life, F. Scott Fitzgerald is writing for Hollywood studios to be able to afford the cost of an asylum for his wife. He is also struggling against alcoholism. Into his life comes the famous gossip columnist.

Title: 109. The Facts of Murder
description: A police detective and his team attempt to solve two crimes committed within a day of each other in neighboring apartment rooms.

Title: 110. Battle Beyond the Sun
description: Two countries race to have the first successful landing on Mars.

Title: 111. The Ghost of Yotsuya
description: The ghost of a samurai's wife takes revenge on her husband.

Title: 112. The Wayward Girl
description: Young Gerd, played by Liv Ullmann, falls for a boy. His family disapproves of her 'loose' reputation. They flee to a cabin, encountering a man who challenges their bond.

Title: 113. The Last Angry Man
description: An aspiring journalist's story of his aged uncle doctor leads to the uncle's life being profiled on TV.

Title: 114. The Naked Venus
description: A young American painter and his French wife move with their small daughter to the US when the husband's father dies. His mother takes an instant dislike to the wife, and when she finds out that her daughter-in-law is a nudist who once posed naked for an artist, she declares her son's wife to be an unfit mother and sets out to break up the marriage--which may not be difficult to do, as the son is a weak-willed "mama's boy" who's terrified to stand up against his domineering mother.

Title: 115. Das Feuerzeug
description: There lived a soldier. He served the king and is now returning home. Once he met an old witch on the way, who promised him mountains of money in exchange for the fact that he would get her an old tinderbox.

Title: 116. Violent Summer
description: Summer 1943: The war is in full swing in southern Italy. Together with friends, Carlo enjoys a carefree summer in youthful na√Øvet√©. He falls in love with Roberta, whose husband was killed in the war.

Title: 117. The Giant of Marathon
description: A Greek soldier leads the fight against an invading Persian army.

Title: 118. The FBI Story
description: A dedicated FBI agent recalls the agency's battles against the Klan, organized crime and Communist spies.

Title: 119. General Della Rovere
description: Bardone, a petty con man, is arrested by the Gestapo and coerced into impersonating a partisan leader in order to expose another resistance organizer.

Title: 120. The Head
description: A scientist invents a serum that keeps a dog's head alive after its body dies.

Title: 121. Paper Flowers
description: Suresh Sinha, a famous director, discovers star potential in Shanti, a woman he stumbled into one rainy evening, and casts her as the lead in a film. In a twist of fate, Shanti becomes a superstar and Suresh faces a decline in his career.

Title: 122. The Five Pennies
description: Danny Kaye cuts loose with his trademark musical clowning. Louis "Satchmo" Armstrong plays his horn and croons in that famed gargling-granite voice. Big Band icons Bob Crosby, Ray Anthony and Shelly Manne join the fun.

Title: 123. The Captain's Table
description: A ship's captain is promoted by his company from tramp steamers to their flagship passenger liner. Although he is a thoroughly competent sailor ready to take charge of such a ship, he is less prepared for the social duties the new position involves, not least the way he becomes the target for all the comely unattached women on board.

Title: 124. Carry on Teacher
description: Pupils run amok at Maudlin Street School in an attempt to hang on to their headmaster. He has applied for a new job, but the students like him and don't want to lose him.

Title: 125. Prince of Space
description: When an alien force tries to invade Earth to steal a powerful new rocket fuel, a mysterious hero intervenes.

Title: 126. Ghost of Dragstrip Hollow
description: Hot rods, monsters and rock'n'roll... In this teen-oriented picture, a gang of greasers hole up in a reputedly haunted mansion after getting evicted from their clubhouse.

Title: 127. The Hangman
description: U.S. Marshal Bovard comes to a small border town to identify and arrest a fugitive, but the whole town seems determined to prevent the Marshal from doing his job.

Title: 128. The Last Days of Pompeii
description: A demobilized centurion returns home to Pompeii to find his father murdered by a gang of black-hooded Christian robbers that terrorizes the city and he decides to investigate the matter while the nearby volcano threatens to erupt.

Title: 129. The Sound and the Fury
description: Drama focusing on a family of Southern aristocrats who are trying to deal with the dissolution of their clan and the loss of its reputation, faith, fortunes, and respect.

Title: 130. Hercules Unchained
description: While negotiating peace between two brothers contesting the throne of Thebes, an amnesiac Hercules is seduced by the evil Queen Omphale.

Title: 131. Yellowstone Kelly
description: In 1870s, in the Sioux territory south of the Missouri, trapper and Indian scout Luther Yellowstone Kelly is hired by the army at Fort Buford but runs into trouble with the Sioux.

Title: 132. The Miracle
description: During the Napoleonic era, in Spain, a young postulant called Teresa falls in love with handsome British captain Michael Stuart, who is recovering with others of his regiment after being wounded. Before leaving, Michael asks Teresa to leave the convent and marry him. Devoted to the statue of the Virgin Mary, Teresa asks for a heavenly sign, but leaves when nothing happens. Then the statue of the Virgin descends from its pedestal and takes Teresa's place, as the young woman joins a gypsy caravan believing Michael has been killed.

Title: 133. The Scapegoat
description: An English schoolteacher meets his lookalike, a French count; and unwillingly swaps identities with him.

Title: 134. The Cousins
description: A pair of cousins share a flat, but animosity begins to build between the two when a woman gets involved.

Title: 135. Dangerous Liaisons
description: Juliette Merteuil and Valmont is a sophisticated couple, always looking for fun and excitement. Both have sexual affairs with others and share their experiences with one another. But there is one rule: never fall in love. But this time Valmont falls madly in love with a girl he meets at a ski resort, Marianne.

Title: 136. The Great War
description: The Italian Army fought against the Austrians during World War I.

Title: 137. Good Day for a Hanging
description: After claiming his daughter's childhood-sweetheart killed the marshal, one man finds himself in conflict with his daughter, his fianc√©e and many of the townsfolk.

Title: 138. Blood and Steel
description: Native girl helps US Seabees free her villagers from Japanese troops.

Title: 139. Tarzan, the Ape Man
description: An English colonel's daughter meets the lord of the jungle who makes her his mate.

Title: 140. Santa Claus
description: With Merlin's aid, Santa Claus must defeat the evil machinations of the devil Pitch to ruin Christmas.

Title: 141. The Big Circus
description: A circus owner tries to keep his financially troubled circus on the road, despite the efforts of a murderous saboteur who has decided that the show must not go on.

Title: 142. The Gene Krupa Story
description: Biopic of famous jazz drummer, Gene Krupa, who becomes a sensation but cannot handle success and life in the fast lane and ends-up broke, struggling with drugs and alcohol.

Title: 143. Hannibal
description: During the Second Punic War in 218 BC, Carthaginian general Hannibal attacks the Roman Republic by crossing the Pyrenees and the Alps with his vast army.

Title: 144. Girls Town
description: Silver is a troubled teenage girl sent to a Catholic reform school, where she has trouble fitting in.

Title: 145. The St. Louis Bank Robbery
description: A gang's plans for a St. Louis bank robbery are complicated when the sister of one of the thieves starts voicing her well-founded suspicions.

Title: 146. Cast a Long Shadow
description: A young man without surname inherits a big indebted ranch and has to prove his worthiness managing a cattle drive

Title: 147. First Man Into Space
description: The first pilot to leave Earth's atmosphere lands, then vanishes; but something with a craving for blood prowls the countryside...

Title: 148. Revenge of the Virgins
description: When white settlers start to move in on their sacred grounds, a tribe of female Indians vow to do anything they can to stop them.

Title: 149. Fires on the Plain
description: In the closing days of WWII, remnants of the Japanese army in Leyte are abandoned by their command and face certain death by starvation.

Title: 150. Goliath and the Barbarians
description: When barbarians invade his village and kill his father, a local man wages a one-man war against them.

Title: 151. The Destiny of a Man
description: A Soviet soldier, Andrei Sokolov, has been separated from his family by World War II. Suffering in German captivity, he dreams of meeting his darlings after the victory. But cruel fate turned out otherwise.

Title: 152. The Black Pit of Dr. M
description: Two doctors make a pact in which they swear that the first to die will return - if possible - to tell the other how to get a glimpse of the afterlife while still alive.

Title: 153. It Started with a Kiss
description: A U.S. sergeant serving in Spain creates envy among his Air Force superiors and the Spanish locals when his brand new futuristic sports car and pretty wife arrive at the base.

Title: 154. The Chaplin Revue
description: Three Charlie Chaplin short films edited together with new connective tissue.

Title: 155. Jack the Ripper
description: A serial killer is murdering women in the Whitechapel district of London. An American policeman is brought in to help Scotland Yard solve the case.

Title: 156. The Man Who Could Cheat Death
description: A centenarian artist and scientist in 1890 Paris maintains his youth and health by periodically replacing a gland with that of a living person.

Title: 157. The Stranglers of Bombay
description: In the 1830s, a captain in the East India Company lobbies to investigate the criminal Thugee Cult of Kali, an organized crime group of stranglers and thieves.

Title: 158. The Big Operator
description: During the 1950s, a corrupt labor union boss and the mob silence all those who witness their shady activities but an honest union member threatens to testify in front of a Senate Committee, thus becoming a murder-target.

Title: 159. Expresso Bongo
description: Johnny Jackson, a sleazy talent agent, discovers teenager Bert Rudge singing in a coffee house, but their exploitative deal leads to a bad relationship.

Title: 160. Don't Give Up the Ship
description: During the 1950s, a military panel grills Junior Officer John Paul Steckler to find the whereabouts of a Navy destroyer that he temporarily commanded during WWII and is missing.

Title: 161. The Oregon Trail
description: In 1846, a newspaperman joins an Oregon Trail wagon train to verify rumors about the U.S. government sending troops disguised as settlers there in order to claim Oregon.

Title: 162. Terror in the Midnight Sun
description: Aliens release a furry critter in the wilds of Lapland where it takes a woman captive and threatens a group of scientists.

Title: 163. Witness in the City
description: Seeking vengeance on his wife's former lover and assassin, a man sets in motion a string of killings.

Title: 164. Picnic on the Grass
description: Etienne Alexis, a scientist promoting artificial insemination for social betterment, hosts an aseptic picnic for his engagement to a German cousin. A windstorm brings him together with N√©nette, a farm lass who is unimpressed with men.

Title: 165. The Four Skulls of Jonathan Drake
description: Anthropologist Jonathan Drake believes that the men of his family have been cursed for generations by the native South American tribe he studies. Shortly after his brother, discovers one of the tribe's shrunken heads, he's found murdered.

Title: 166. Curse of the Undead
description: While a malady is claiming the lives of young women in a Western town, a sinister gunslinger-for-hire Drake Robey is really a vampire, and it's up to Preacher Dan to save the town and girlfriend Dolores Carter.

Title: 167. The Crimson Kimono
description: Two detectives seek a stripper's killer in the Japanese quarter of Los Angeles, but a love triangle threatens their friendship.

Title: 168. Upstairs and Downstairs
description: When a young man marries the bosses daughter, the young couple must now do the company entertaining. But it isn't easy getting good help, as they go through a procession of strange and stranger servants.

Title: 169. 4D Man
description: A scientist discovers a formula enabling him to pass through solid surfaces, but he also rapidly ages, which forces him to kill humans in order to reverse the aging process by absorbing his victims' energies.

Title: 170. Fiasco in Milan
description: The usual gang of robbers in engaged by a thief from Milan to steal a suitcase full of money, but troubles will menace the success of the operation.

Title: 171. Night Train
description: Jerzy enters a train set for the Baltic coast. He seems to be on the run from something, as does the strange woman with whom he must share a sleeping compartment.

Title: 172. Too Many Crooks
description: In this spoof on crime films, four would-be criminals manage to botch every job they plan. When they try to rob wealthy Billy Gordon (Terry-Thomas) they fail again. But the gang decides to kidnap his daughter.

Title: 173. Araya
description: "Araya" is an old natural salt mine located in a peninsula in northeastern Venezuela which was still, by 1959, being exploited manually five hundred years after its discovery by the Spanish. Margot Benacerraf captures in images, the life of the "salineros" and their archaic methods of work before their definite disappearance with the arrival of the industrial exploitation.

Title: 174. The Monster of Piedras Blancas
description: The monster, which looks like a snarling "Creature from the Black Lagoon," invades a sleepy seaside town. The lighthouse keeper, widowed and estranged from the town folk, has been secretly leaving food out for the monster for years, unaware of its blood lust. When the monster's appetite outstrips the keeper's ability to serve it, bloodless decapitated corpses start to show up.

Title: 175. Three Crooked Men
description: Three criminals decide to rob a bank by drilling through the party wall from the general store next door. The store owner is already going through a personal crisis.

Title: 176. The Mating Game
description: An uptight IRS agent is ordered to investigate a rural family in debt to the government...but the family - including lovely daughter Mariette - help him loosen up.

Title: 177. The Blue Angel
description: During the 1950s in a small German town, high school Professor Immanuel Rath falls in-love with a young cabaret entertainer, with dramatic consequences.

Title: 178. Blue Denim
description: Fairly-typical 1950s teenagers Arthur Bartley and Janet Willard find their lives turned upside-down when Janet becomes pregnant. Arthur is desperate to tell his parents of the predicament he and Janet are in, but when he can't manage to, he arranges for Janet to have an abortion. The internal turmoil that this causes him finally forces him to tell his father, who races to save Janet from the back-room abortionist.

Title: 179. Manster
description: An American journalist stationed in Japan is given a mysterious injection by a mad scientist, turning him into a murderous, two-headed monster.

Title: 180. Teenage Zombies
description: A crazed female scientist uses nerve gas to turn local teenagers into her unquestioning slaves.

Title: 181. The Gazebo
description: TV writer Elliott Nash buries something under the new gazebo in his suburban backyard. But the nervous man can't let it rest there.

Title: 182. Maiden's Cheek
description: A young idealist scholar at an all-girls boarding school comes face to face with the institution's privileged students. Will they learn a thing or two about respect? Can a little discipline pave the way for a fresh whirlwind romance?

Title: 183. Horrors of the Black Museum
description: A frustrated thriller writer wants accurate crimes for his next book so he hypnotizes his assistant to make him commit the required crimes.

Title: 184. That Kind of Woman
description: In 1944, on a Miami to New York train, two paratroopers on furlough meet and fall in love with two 'kept women' who are on their way to meet their 'sugar-daddies'.

Title: 185. The Big Fisherman
description: Exploring the life of Peter, from being a successful fisherman to becoming a follower of Jesus Christ and being dependent on Jesus Christ.

Title: 186. Nazarin
description: A priest in a poor community lives a charitable life in accordance with his religious principles, but many others do not return the favor.

Title: 187. City of Fear
description: A vicious killer escapes from San Quentin with a canister of what he believes to be heroin but is actually a radioactive substance that threatens all Los Angeles.

Title: 188. Sign of the Gladiator
description: Zenobia, Queen of Palmyra, revolts against Rome and defeats the Roman troops - but she makes a big mistake when she falls in love with enemy officer Marco Valerio.

Title: 189. Cover Girl Killer
description: Set in the sleazy world of a backstreet 1950s nightclub, a serial killer is believed to be murdering the models of a glamour magazine.

Title: 190. Uncle Was a Vampire
description: A baron down on his luck has to sell his family castle to pay off his mounting debt. After the castle is turned into a hotel, he's hired as a bellboy. But all is not lost, as he discovers he has a rich uncle; unfortunately, he's a vampire.

Title: 191. Invisible Invaders
description: Invisible aliens from the Moon invade the Earth by occupying the bodies of recently deceased humans but a scientist, his daughter and an army Major, try to fight them.

Title: 192. Have Rocket -- Will Travel
description: The 3 Stooges are cleaners at a spaceport when they accidentally take off and land on Venus. The boys encounter a talking unicorn, a giant fire breathing tarantula and an alien computer that creates three evil duplicates of the Stooges.

Title: 193. John Paul Jones
description: The career of Revolutionary War naval hero from his youth in Scotland through his service to Catherine the Great of Russia.

Title: 194. Please Turn Over
description: The orderly suburban life of a 1950s English town is turned on its head when the teenage daughter of one of the residents writes a steamy bestseller featuring characters obviously based on the local population. They begin to see themselves and their neighbours in a surprising new light.

Title: 195. Navrang
description: Divakar is a poet who adores his wife, Jamuna, and soon begins to see her as his muse in his imagination and even names her Mohini. But his obsession with Mohini begins to destroy his home and career.

Title: 196. The Wild Women of Wongo
description: Men, women and apes live together as three different tribes on the tropical island of Wongo. When the tribes discover that they live together on the island, ape-men start planning a raid on the tribe in order to capture mates.

Title: 197. The Jayhawkers!
description: Before the U.S. Civil War rebel leader Luke Darcy sees himself as leader of a new independent Republic of Kansas but the military governor sends an ex-raider to capture Darcy.

Title: 198. Fever Mounts at El Pao
description: Aroused citizens assassinate an unpopular Caribbean despot, then two men vie for his gorgeous widow Ines. Ojeda is a steamy, isolated island, the penal colony for an oppressive dictatorship. A reactionary seizes the murdered governor's post and rushes to eliminate his romantic rival, an idealistic underling. The bureaucrat Vazquez hopes to marshal the angry residents of the capitol, El Pao, plus the many political prisoners, to oust Governor Gual.

Title: 199. Night of the Ghouls
description: A phony spiritualist raises the dead.

Title: 200. Jazz on a Summer's Day
description: The highlights of the 1958 Newport Jazz Festival.

Title: 201. Breakout
description: In 1943, an Italian-administered P.O.W. camp for captured Allies goes through a series of failed escapes only to culminate in a daring plan for a dramatic mass escape.

Title: 202. Career
description: More than anything in the world, Sam Lawson wants to be a successful actor. Is he willing to sacrifice his wife, happiness and personal reputation to achieve his goal?

Title: 203. Ask Any Girl
description: A salesgirl falls for the younger of two brothers who run a company. The elder falls for her but plans to help her get his brother because he doesn't know he's in love.

Title: 204. The Angry Hills
description: In 1941, the Greek resistance entrusts an American journalist with a secret Greek double-agent list that must reach London and not fall into German hands.

Title: 205. 1001 Arabian Nights
description: Mr. Magoo's ancestor, Abdul Aziz Magoo, is the uncle of Aladdin, who falls in love with a princess.

Title: 206. The Chasers
description: Two young men, one shy and one self-confident, spend a fast-paced night in Paris trying to pick up chicks. They confront every possible difficulty.

Title: 207. For the First Time
description: An opera singer with a bad attitude falls in love with a deaf girl who changes his life.

Title: 208. Island of Lost Women
description: A plane makes an emergency landing on a jungle island inhabited by a scientist and his three nubile young daughters. Complications ensue.

Title: 209. The Cosmic Man
description: A spherical UFO proves to contain one alien visitor. How to deal with him? Investigators disagree...

Title: 210. But Not for Me
description: Without a new play and money, a 55 y.o. Broadway theater producer retires. But when fired, his 22 y.o. secretary says, she loves him. He decides to make that a scene in a new play and her to write it and play the role.

Title: 211. Cuban Rebel Girls
description: Errol Flynn , playing himself as a war correspondent, helps Fidel Castro overthrow Cuban dictator Fulgencio Batista . The film was shot, with Castro's cooperation, while he was still fighting Batista.

Title: 212. Guns Girls and Gangsters
description: In Las Vegas, a group of assorted criminals plans the robbery of an armored truck hauling casino money to the bank.

Title: 213. Ups and Downs
description: It is the story of a sportsman who is a little bit dumber than most people but nevertheless he succeeds in getting a job at a sports article saler's. Having this job is the beginning of a lot of funny problems he causes due to his dumbness.

Title: 214. Web of Passion
description: A wealthy wine grower has trouble with his wife, his children, his best friend, and his mistress across the way, who is murdered.

Title: 215. Ten Seconds to Hell
description: After 1945, six German ex-soldiers are hired to defuse unexploded Allied bombs in the ruins of Berlin.

Title: 216. A Stranger Knocks
description: A stranger knocks on the the door of a widow who's husband was tortured and killed by the Danish Nazis during World War Two. They fall in love, but then, suddenly, she realizes that her lover is the man who murdered her husband.

Title: 217. Operation Amsterdam
description: When Germany invades Holland in 1940, a British intelligence officer and two Dutch diamond merchants go to Amsterdam to persuade the Dutch diamond merchants to evacuate their diamond supplies to England.

Title: 218. The Journey
description: A British woman trying to escape Hungary with her freedom fighter lover and a group of Westerners, as the Soviet Union moves to crush the Hungarian Revolution of 1956, finds herself the obsession of an enigmatic Communist officer.

Title: 219. High School Big Shot
description: Marv needs money for his girlfriend Betty; thanks to his mob ties, he knows where to find $1 million in cash.

Title: 220. The Trap
description: In a remote Californian desert town, a lawyer arranges for a wanted mobster to skip the country via a small airstrip but the local sheriff and his deputy could pose a problem.

Title: 221. Say One for Me
description: Father Conroy (Crosby) has a parish which serves the acting and performance community. When one of his parishoners gets too sick to work, his daughter Holly (Reynolds) finds a job working for a dance club of questionable character, which is run by Tony Vincent (Wagner). Vincent never made the big time, and Father Conroy tries to look after Holly. There are many musical numbers, and the conclusion is a televised benefit show hosted by Father Conroy, and Tony must choose between Holly and national fame.

Title: 222. Anari
description: A poor young man gets employed by a rich man admiring his honesty. But when he gets suspected in a lady's murder case, he need to prove his innocence.

Title: 223. The Nightingale's Prayer
description: This compelling tale of love and betrayal, set in the upper Egyptian countryside, follows the story of Amna as she plots her revenge on the engineer who destroyed her family's honor.

Title: 224. Le chemin des √©coliers
description: Le chemin des ecoliers (The Way of Youth) is a 1959 French film starring Alain Delon. It is based in the novel The Transient Hour by Marcel Ayme.

Title: 225. The Headless Ghost
description: Three teenagers encounter a ghost who is in limbo until he retrieves his lost head. They do their bit to help him find it.

Title: 226. The 30 Foot Bride of Candy Rock
description: In one of his rare performances without Bud Abbott, Lou Costello plays a rubbish collector and inventor. When radiation in a nearby cave turns his girlfriend into a giantess, antics ensue as he tries to shrink her using one of his inventions.

Title: 227. Maigret and the St. Fiacre Case
description: The Countess de Saint-Fiacre, having received a terrible anonymous letter predicting her imminent death, summons Commissioner Maigret in the hope that he can protect her and save her from a secret ill-wisher.

Title: 228. The Incredible Petrified World
description: When the cable breaks on their diving bell four people find themselves trapped in a hidden underwater world.

Title: 229. The Princess with the Golden Star
description: A Czech fairy tale about a princess named Lada who runs away from home in a mouse-fur disguise in order to escape an unwanted, forced marriage.

Title: 230. Sensuikan I-57 k√¥fuku sezu
description: A story set in the time of WWII about one of the most famous Japansese submarines fighting through hardships to achieve its final goal

Title: 231. Jet Storm
description: A grieving father boards a plane, threatening to detonate a bomb unless the man responsible for his daughter's death is found. The film follows the various passengers and their personal storylines as the tense situation unfolds mid-flight.

Title: 232. Terror Is a Man
description: A mad scientist transforms a panther into a man-like creature that escapes and goes on a murderous rampage.

Title: 233. Surrender - Hell!
description: An officer leads a band of Filipino guerrillas against the Japanese in anticipation of Gen. Douglas MacArthur's return.

Title: 234. Come Dance with Me!
description: Handsome dentist Herve Dandieu, temporarily separated from his new, delectable wife Virginie by a lovers' tiff, is picked up by sexy dance teacher Anita Flores...object blackmail. Sensing trouble, Virginie follows him to the dance school, only to find him circumstantially incriminated in murder. Soon, the school has a gorgeous new instructress, whose slightly scatterbrained attempts to clear her husband confuse both police and suspects...and bring potential danger.

Title: 235. This Earth Is Mine
description: During Prohibition, Englishwoman Elizabeth Rambeau joins her winemaking California family, but while some see her as an unwanted "poor relation," others covet her affections, including her troublemaker playboy cousin John Rambeau.

Title: 236. India: Matri Bhumi
description: Several stories depicting the landscapes and fauna of India are mixed with documentary footage.

Title: 237. Marie-Octobre
description: Fifteen years after WWII, a group of ex-resistance fighters are brought together by Marie-Octobre, so that the former members of the network can finally relive one fateful night and find out who betrayed their murdered leader, Castille.

Title: 238. I tartassati
description: Mr. Pezzella owns and operates a well-established luxury-clothing store. He does not like and does not consider it right to pay taxes and therefore uses a tax consultant to be able to evade more taxes.

Title: 239. I Mobster
description: The rise and fall of gang lord Joe Sante.

Title: 240. These Thousand Hills
description: An ambitious cowboy will stop at nothing to get what he wants, including using the affections of two women.

Title: 241. The Cow and I
description: In 1942, a French prisoner of war in Germany decides to escape to France using a cow held by a lunge as a decoy. He crosses all Germany in this way.

Title: 242. Entrei de Gaiato
description: Janu√°rio is a crook who sells inexistent tombs on Caju Cemetery and pretends to be a relative of Juscelino Kubitschek's, then president of Brazil.

Title: 243. Night of the Quarter Moon
description: A young man returns to San Francisco and his wealthy family with a new bride. His family objects to his marriage as his wife is mixed race and his mother is determined to have it annulled.

Title: 244. The Man in the Net
description: A struggling artist in a small town becomes the prime suspect when his wife mysteriously disappears.

Title: 245. Take a Giant Step
description: A Black teenager copes with life in a predominantly White society. Based on Louis S. Peterson's play.

Title: 246. Two Men in Manhattan
description: A French UN delegate has disappeared into thin air, sending reporter Moreau and hard drinking photographer Delmas on an assignment to find him. Their only lead is a picture of three women.

Title: 247. Chance Meeting
description: In 1950s London, Dutch painter Jan Van Rooyen has an affair with a rich married Frenchwoman who is supposedly murdered, resulting in Van Rooyen becoming Scotland Yard's prime suspect.

Title: 248. The Pirate and the Slave Girl
description: When a ship carrying the daughter of Rhodes' governor and secret documents is captured by Mediterranean pirate Dragut, the governor tasks captain Diego with their recovery before they can be sold to Sultan Selim.

Title: 249. Stalingrad: Dogs, Do You Want to Live Forever?
description: In the winter of 1943, against the background of battle scenes, a young German Lieutenant who increasingly distrusts the inhuman Nazi ideology struggles with the concept of war.

Title: 250. Yotsuya kaidan
description: Kenji MISUMI's YOTSUYA KWAIDAN is presumed to be the first colored film version of the famous play. Deviating heavily from the original source, Fuji YAHIRO depicts cold blooded protagonist Iemon as a tragic hero. The "righteous revenge" for his ruthlessly murdered wife leads to the redemption of her evil spirit. The visionary finale is without a question the apex of this underrated masterpiece.

Title: 251. Gunmen from Laredo
description: After his wife's murder, Gil Reardon seeks revenge on Ben Keefer. Framed for murder, he escapes prison. The Marshal permits Reardon to face Keefer and his brothers, criminals the Marshal couldn't convict. Reardon confronts them alone.

Title: 252. The Man Who Understood Women
description: A producer is obsessed with turning his wife into a sexy star, ignoring her needs, and prompting her to return to France, where she becomes attracted to an attentive pilot, and ensuing a revenge plot by a jealous husband, that goes astray.

Title: 253. Woman Obsessed
description: On a farm in the Canadian North-West, a young widow becomes the source of a jealous rivalry between her little son and her new husband.

Title: 254. Nature's Paradise
description: An American art student in England falls in love with a beautiful Englishwoman. It turns out that she's a nudist, and in spite of his misgivings, he decides to join her at her nudist camp.

Title: 256. Left Right and Centre
description: At the Earndale by-election natural history expert and TV personality Bob Wilcot for the Conservatives finds himself up against Billingsgate girl Stella Stoker for the socialists. Amateur politician against committed activist. But could it become boy-who-fancies-girl against girl-who-fancies-boy? The party agents are soon colluding against such a disaster.

Title: 257. Three Murderesses
description: Julien turns up at one of his former girlfriends' wedding; she is marrying an "old man" (32). But the newly wed Agathe does not want to give the hunk up.

Title: 258. The Rebel Set
description: Three beatniks are brought together to rob an armored car, only to face betrayal from amongst their ranks.

Title: 259. Never Steal Anything Small
description: Jake MacIllaney will do just about anything to win the presidential election of longshoreman union Local 26. When he encounters young upright attorney Dan Cabot and Cabot's attractive wife, Linda, MacIllaney breaks up their marriage, pursues Linda, and pins a grand larceny rap on Dan. And all set to music!

Title: 260. The White Trap
description: Serving a jail sentence for a crime he didn't commit, Paul Langley makes several attempts to escape from prison, in order to clear his name. He also has other problems, his wife is about to go into labor with their first baby.

Title: 261. Ut mot havet
description: A story about the fishermen, the vessel, the fishing, and the catch, with the development of new boat types and gear, about crises and big fishing through 100 years. Starting in a fishing home on the coast around 1860, ending with whaling.

Title: 262. Temptation
description: When a ship bringing a contingent of international wounded from Korea is torpedoed, three women (two nurses and a secretary) and a male journalist survive and reach a lonely island in a boat. Soon desire erupts among them, but jealousy, lust and madness lead the events to tragedy.

Title: 263. Escuela de verano
description: Young women from around the world enroll in Escuela de Verano, a Mexico City summer school supervised by the bumbling Casimiro.

Title: 264. Hound-Dog Man
description: A farm boy and his dog go hunting with his teenage brother (Fabian) and an older friend (Stuart Whitman) in 1912.

Title: 265. Hier bin ich - hier bleib' ich
266. Face of the Frog
description: Scotland Yard and an American playboy investigate a criminal gang led by a mysterious man in a frog-like mask.

Title: 267. Gigantis: The Fire Monster
description: The heavily re-edited American version of Godzilla Raids Again. A prehistoric monster called Gigantis emerges alongside another creature named Angurus.

Title: 268. A Private's Affair
description: Three U.S. Army recruits have various romantic adventures while preparing to appear on a televised talent show.

Title: 269. Las coronelas
description: A general obsessed with his mark in history goes from town to town demanding payment for his services. One man cannot afford to pay the general but puts his two sons up for trade. The general becomes godfather of the boys and when they come of age, they will go to war with the general. Little does the general know that the two baby boys are actually girls.

Title: 270. The Depot of the Dead
description: Because of the danger involved and the harsh conditions, wood transport drivers, working in the forests of south-east Poland, are going to quit their jobs. A party activist arrives to make them change their minds.

Title: 271. Anak ng bulkan
description: A monstrous giant bird soars high across Manila and suburbs. Anak ng Bulkan was set in a remote volcanic island, tells of the friendship between a little boy named Bentoy (Ace York) and a giant bird named Goliat.

Title: 272. Come Back, Africa
description: Come Back, Africa chronicles the life of Zachariah, a black South African living under the rule of the harsh apartheid government in 1959.

Title: 273. Le Bossu
description: Prince Philippe de Gonzague decides to get rid of his cousin Duke de Nevers, having wished for long his properties and wealth.

Title: 274. Gunfighters of Abilene
description: A gunman receives a request for help from his brother, but arrives too late to save him from the lawless rancher who wanted him dead.

Title: 275. The Rabbit Trap
description: Job or family? The perennial conflict is depicted in this drama about a draftsman able to free himself from the job for a very overdue family vacation, who is threatened with the sack if he doesn't return to work mid-holiday.

Title: 276. The Naked Road
description: An innocent girl is held captive by a public relations, white slavery gang and is threatened with torture if she doesn't go to work for them, but her will remains strong.

Title: 277. Holiday for Lovers
description: When his oldest daughter decides to stay in South America while on a school tour, her father decides to take the rest of the family there for vacation to find out why.

Title: 278. The House of the Seven Hawks
description: The film follows an American captain searching for sunken treasure who becomes entangled with criminals and is arrested by the Dutch police.

Title: 279. Go, Johnny, Go!
description: Rock-n-roll promoter Alan Freed holds a talent search to develop a new rock star, then must find the elusive, mystery contestant (Jimmy Clanton) who doesn't know he has won.

Title: 280. The Last Inch
description: A boy must reach civilization on a plane for saving his wounded father.

Title: 281. Poor Millionaires
description: Salvatore has an accident that makes him lose his memory and becomes director of the department store where his brother-in-law works.

Title: 282. The Three Treasures
description: A prince, framed for murder and starved for affection from his father, is sent on a quest.

Title: 283. Wandering Jews
description: Two friends and expert shop assistants pluck up the courage to start their own business and venture into the world of instalment selling. Intent on succeeding, they hit the road; but, it is easier said than done. Can they make it work?

Title: 284. Verboten!
description: A young American serviceman stationed in Germany after the fall of the Third Reich jeopardizes his position with the Marshall Plan relief effort by breaking the non-fraternization rule and falling in love with a young German woman. He uses his position to obtain food and luxuries for her that are in short supply, and all seems to be going well for the couple. What he doesn't realize is that the Werewolves, the Nazi guerrilla movement, has plans in which he features heavily.

Title: 285. Costa Azzurra
description: Various short stories. Giovanna arrives from Rome with her husband Alberto for a film audition. The journalist Gino comes to interview the great industrial Signore Carsoli. The famous American actress Rita is in search of her umpteenth husband. Leopoldo and Angelina from Sicily are on vacation in The French Riviera where they meet the street smart Nicola.

Title: 286. A Father-in-Law with a Heart of Gold
description: After a chance encounter with a charming Athenian belle, a young solicitor decides to marry the woman of his dreams. However, there is one little problem: the bride-to-be's stern father. But, what if he, too, had a skeleton in the closet?

Title: 287. Libel
description: A shell-shocked World War II veteran with memory problems is accused of being an impostor by a former comrade.

Title: 288. The Big Night
description: In Rome, small-time thieves Scinttilone and Ruggeretto steal four rifles and catch prostitutes Anna and Supplizia on the street to mislead the police. They seek the jobber Mosciarella, but he is at a funeral and gives them no attention. But Gino "Bellabella" overhears them and offers to deal the merchandise with another contact. He fails and the whores present a deaf-mute acquaintance who lives on the outskirts of Rome to buy the guns; the prostitute Nicoletta who was with the man returns to Rome with the quintet. When the youngsters propose to have sex in the middle of nowhere, the prostitutes believe that they intend to leave them there. Scinttilone, Ruggeretto, and Bellabella sneak out to the car and leave the women in the countryside. Later they discover that the women stole their money. They seek them out on the streets and fight against another gang. However, when the police arrive, the six youngsters leave the place together and head to the house of one of them, and Ruggeretto falls for the host's sister. However, Bellabella steals the host's bountiful wallet and Ruggeretto fights him to get the wallet and return it to the host. While they are fighting, Scinttilone flees with the wallet to the house of his girlfriend Rossana. Ruggeretto chases Scinttilone along a night of alienation, illusions, and adventures.

Title: 289. The Widower
description: A mediocre businessman who's married to a much more successful businesswoman relies heavily on her financial support for his bad business ideas, and to pay off his mounting debt, but both of them have had enough of each other.

Title: 290. The Legend of Tom Dooley
description: Tom Dooley and Country Boy are on the run after killing an enemy soldier not knowing the war is over. The Command refuses to give them some slack for making this tragic but honest mistake and sends a lawman after them.

Title: 291. Watusi
description: Alan Quartermain's son comes to Africa to find the treasure his father was unable to bring home.

Title: 292. She Walks by Night
description: Inspired by the life and death of Rosemarie Nitribitt, a famous German call girl whose death caused a large scandal in the press.

Title: 293. Dil Deke Dekho
description: An adopted rich heiress falls in love with a drummer who is unaware of his family's background.

Title: 294. SOS Pacific
description: Due to an accident, a seaplane operated by a small airline company ditches off an island in the Pacific and the surviving passengers must find a way to be rescued.

Title: 295. Tre m√• man v√¶re
description: A lawyer has a wife and a mistress. He loves them both equally high and together, they're the perfect wife.

Title: 296. Legions of the Nile
description: Roman Emperor Octavian rules the empire from Rome, and his rival Marc Antony has taken Egyptian queen Cleopatra as his lover and seized the eastern empire, ruling it from Alexandria. Octavian intends to regain his empire by landing his army at Alexandria, besieging the city and capturing and executing the pair. However, while Octavian's army is bigger than Marc Antony's forces, he and Cleopatra have allies who can come to their aid. Both sides prepare for a final showdown.

Title: 297. Killers of Kilimanjaro
description: In the 19th century, during the German colonial rule, railway engineer Robert Adamson arrives in the Kilimanjaro Region to finish building a railroad through hostile territory.

Title: 298. Raj Tilak
description: A young man goes on a quest to find his mother and to restore justice in a kingdom that has fallen into the hands of traitors.

Title: 300. The Last Blitzkrieg
description: The fanatical son of a Nazi General leads a squad of German commandos, disguised as American Troops, behind the lines in order to sabotage the Allied Forces. Stars Van Johnson, Kerwin Matthews, Dick York and Larry Storch.

Title: 301. Dhool Ka Phool
description: Mahesh and Meena fall in love but he marries another girl at his father's behest. When Meena takes their baby to Mahesh, he rejects her saying their relationship was a mistake.

Title: 302. The Kingdom and the Beauty
description: A bored Ming Dynasty Emperor decides to take a vacation from his regal duties to a village that boast to have beautiful women. He then happens on a local beauty Li-feng, an innocent waitress who works in a local wine shop.

Title: 303. The Louisiana Hussy
description: Cajun newlyweds must deal with the jealousy of his brother, who also loved her, and the arrival of a mysterious seductress in their bayou backwater.

Title: 304. Face of Fire
description: A local handyman saves a child in a fire, but the burns he receives disfigure his face so much that the townspeople avoid him.

Title: 305. Magic Boy
description: A young Japanese boy climbs a mountain in search of a magic wizard. The youth finds the wizard, and is tutored by him. Reinforced with magic powers, the boy eventually fights and defeats the evil witches of down under.

Title: 306. Black Cat
description: Few people in real life would relish making the decision that Inspector Rajan is forced to take when he corners the identity of Black Cat a notorious character who lives the life of a professor by day and a crook by night. Inspector Rajan is deputed to bring in Black Cat dead or alive by his chief, the Commissioner of Police. Despite his long record of success in the police force, Rajan is driven to desperation at the sheer genius of Black Cat who avoids all the nets laid for him. Also engaged in the chase of Black Cat is a jovial private detective and his untiring secretary Bul Bul. The pair start on their own collect clues and despite the seeing bufoonery of Popat, played by Johny Walker and his ubiquitous companion, Shammi, they manage to bring to light quite a bit of information after many hair-raising adventures into the den of Black Cat. Meanwhile Inspector Rajan gets his long-needed break and suddenly the entire police force is electrified into activity, as the true identity of the notorious gangster is revealed.But all hearsay is of no avail.Rajan must have proof of Black Cat's guilt. This sets the stage for the most thrilling screen adventures of the day. Black Cat and his hoodlums work so methodically and are so well organized that to unravel the mystery of their gang the Inspector must venture right into the midst of their headquarters, and carry his life in his own hands, to put it literally.

Title: 307. Rani Rupmati
description: During Akbar's rule over Hindustan, the Mughal's considered Pathans their enemies and vice versa. As a result there was a war-like relation between Mandva's Sultan Sujat Khan and Akbar. But Sujat's son, Wajid, was a peace-maker and a lover of the arts. He befriended a Hindu Kshtriya, Rajkumari Rupmati, of Mandhavghar, and despite protests from her parents, brothers, and to-be husband, Baldev Singh, she re-located to Mandva, where Wajid build her a tower so that she could view and seek blessings from holy river Narmada, who had gifted her to Mandhavghar. She became instrumental in diverting Narmada to bring water to her drought-stricken hometown. After Sujat passes away, Wajid becomes the Sultan and is called Bagh Bahadur. Akbar hears about this and sends Sangeet Samrat Tansen to check out Rupmati as well as find out if they wanted peace or war. Tansen was welcomed, and assured that Wajid wanted nothing but peace. But their peaceful lives will soon be turned upside when Tansen gets abducted by Subedar Hafiz Khan, is held against his will. An enraged Akbar asks his Chieftain Adam Khan to storm Malwa and free Tansen. In the meantime, Hafiz' daughter, who is in love with Wajid, gets into Rupmati's palace - with one intent - to kill her. Watch the outcome as the Pathans together with their Hindu allies, amidst mixed chants of 'Allah O Akbar' and 'Har Har Mahadev' prepare themselves for Akbar's armies, and how Rupmati defends herself against Hamida.

Title: 308. The Swindlers
description: Mario is in Hannover to work as a miner but after loosing his job he decides to go back to Italy. When Totonno steals his passport to avoid the police and later on he offers him a new job as "magliaro" (cloth seller), Mario changes his mind and decides to follow Totonno to Hamburg. In Hamburg, Totonno and his friends have to sell Mayer's cloth but they meet with the hostility of a Polish gang and Mario falls in love with Paula Mayer.

Title: 309. Five Bold Women
description: A Texas Marshal transports five female prisoners to prison but their stagecoach is attacked en route by the Comanches and the ex-husband of one prisoner attempts to free her.

Title: 310. Sign√©: Ars√®ne Lupin
description: Ars√®ne Lupin and his accomplice La Ballu rob a villa. Being disturbed by the police, they have time to take a picture. This painting represents a fresco in three parts, La Ballu steals the second painting. The third painting is in the Florence Museum but when Lupin arrives, the painting is gone.

Title: 311. The Rookie
description: Pvt. Thomas Noonan and Sgt. Pete Marshall are both vying for the hand of Lili Marlene. After World War II ends, the three of them get stranded on a remote island. Two Japanese sailors, unaware that the war has ended, arrive on the island.

Title: 312. Veerapandiya Kattabomman
description: When the British East India Company forces polygar Kattabomman to pay taxes, levies and be their subsidiary ruler, he openly defies their policy and battles them until his arrest and hanging.

Title: 313. Kiss Her Goodbye
description: Psychological tale about the disintegration of a young woman's sanity.

Title: 314. Paratroop Command
description: A squad member of the U.S. Paratroop unit in WWII accidently shoots one of his unit. Over the forthcoming months there is some anamosity against him as they battle their way across Italy.

Title: 315. The Soldiers of Pancho Villa
description: The Cucaracha is a brave woman soldier who leads a group of similar women into the fray against the forces of the Villa colonel, Zeta.

Title: 316. A Midsummer Night's Dream
description: The first puppet kinescope in the world. It is based on the famous poetic comedy by William Shakespeare. Three worlds meet in this story: the noble world of three Athens couples, a common popular world of tradesmen amateur theatre and a fairy-tale happiness of magic creatures as elves and nymphs. The film is considered the most remarkable Jir√≠ Trnka's work and a milestone in the history of the world animation.

Title: 317. Count Your Blessings
description: Grace hastily marries a French aristocrat during World War II, but is separated from him by circumstances for nearly nine years.

Title: 318. A Dog's Best Friend
description: A young orphan rejects his foster parents--instead turning to a German Shepard whose master was recently murdered. Stumbling on some evidence, the boy is rescued from the killer by his dog.

Title: 319. A Stranger in My Arms
description: After the Korean War, an Air Force pilot meets the family of his KIA navigator and recalls, in flashbacks, the circumstances of their ordeal after being shot down.

Title: 320. Follow a Star
description: Norman Truscott is a store worker who dreams of stardom. Vernon Carew is a singer who's star is fading. Vernon manages to get a recording of Norman singing and passes it off as himself.

Title: 321. Insaan Jaag Utha
description: A village girl falls in love with the newcomer Ranjeet without knowing that he is there to get the smuggled gold that he buried in her front yard many years ago.

Title: 322. Fr√∂ken Chic
description: An agent on the brink of bankruptcy finds a reluctant singing talent on a TV quiz show.

Title: 323. Babette Goes to War
description: A naive French country girl in London helps the war effort by parachuting into German-occupied France to help kidnap an important German general. She bungles through a heroic adventure of plot and counter-plot.

Title: 324. The Purple Gang
description: The story of the infamous Purple Gang, a ring of bootleggers, hijackers and killers in 1920s' Detroit.

Title: 325. Gangster Story
description: Hoodlum Jack Martin is on the lam and robs a small town bank which brings the local cops and local crime boss into the mix.

Title: 326. The Story on Page One
description: Courtroom drama about an adulterous pair who is charged with murdering the outraged husband of the cheating woman.

Title: 328. The Young Land
description: An American gunslinger kills a Mexican man in California immediately after the Mexican-American war. The killer is arrested and put on trial for murder with the Hispanic population waiting to learn of American justice.

Title: 329. The Young Captives
description: Gripping melodrama about newlyweds involved with a psychopathic killer who holds them captive.

Title: 330. The Savage Eye
description: This drama takes the form of a story told using documentary material as an intrinsic part of the narrative. In this journey through the dark side of 1950s urban life, the camera follows Judith - a newly divorced woman looking for a fresh start - through the streets of Los Angeles as she encounters the strange denizens of the city, ranging from trendsetters to religious fanatics. All the tawdry and desperate faces of this world become a mirror for Judith's personal failures and struggles to claim her new life.

Title: 331. First Love
description: Various sentimental events of a group of young people in Rome.

A managing editor of a LA newspaper must put together headlines for the next day in a way that'll attract the potential readers, deal with hectic going-ons at the workplace and have a serious talk with his wife about her wish to adopt.

Title: 333. No Trees in the Street
description: London detective recalls 1930s poverty. Hetty battles brother's criminality, manipulative mother favoring racketeer Wilkie for gain. Slums contrasted with new high-rises.

Title: 334. T-Bird Gang
description: A high school boy, out to find his father's killer, joins up with a gang of juvenile delinquents.

Title: 335. Thunder in the Sun
description: 1850 adventure story of the Basque immigrants on their way to California, their struggle with the Indians, and the development of a complicated love triangle.

Title: 336. The White Warrior
description: The story of Hadji Murad, a 19th-century Chechen chieftain who led his warriors in a fight against the invading forces of the Russian Czar.

Title: 337. The Ugly Duckling
description: Henry Jeckle was always the outsider, a bungling and awkward buffoon, relegated to waiting for his invitation to participate in life that never arrived: until he discovers a medical formula developed by a dead uncle, which claimed to turn 'a man of timid disposition into a bold, fearless dragon'. Taking a draught of the elixir Henry is transformed into suave, sophisticated and highly desirable Teddy Hyde. Armed with his new persona, Teddy is ready to face the world; but is Henry ready for the consequences?

Title: 338. The Nights of Lucretia Borgia
description: Central Italy in the Late Middle Ages. Federico, a virtuous nobleman from an impoverished family, is brought into service by autocrat Cesare Borgia. His promiscuous sister Lucrezia seems to have an amorous interest in Federico and wants him as her lover though Federico is in love with Diana, the Duke of Alva's daughter, whom he has saved from being raped. When he learns about Diana's feud against the Borgia clan, he becomes aware of their infamous deeds.

Title: 339. Man in a Cocked Hat
description: A former British colony in dire need of economic aid tries to play the British against the Soviets in an attempt to secure economic aid from either side in return for political loyalty.

Title: 340. Wrong Number
description: Because she dials the wrong number, an old lady hears information which enables the police to solve a robbery and murder.

Title: 342. Herod the Great
description: Herod, King of Judea, is made a prisoner by the Romans. Convinced the King is dead, his faithful lieutenant, Aaron, is nevertheless unable to keep his promise to kill the Queen if something untoward happened to the King. He leads the young woman out into the desert. Herod's pleas to Augustus are successful and he returns to his palace. His son, Antipater, informs Herod that Aaron has betrayed him.

Title: 343. Prisoner of the Volga
description: A vicious play of intrigue, about love, desire and betrayal, in the dress of the military at the Cossacks around 1890.

Title: 344. Head Against the Wall
description: In order to get rid of his troublesome son Fran√ßois, Ma√Ætre G√©rane manages to have him committed to a mental hospital owned by Dr. Varmont, a supporter of traditional treatments, in constant conflict with Dr. Emery, whose therapy takes the psychology of patients into account. Fran√ßois soon makes friends with Heurtevent, a sweet epileptic, and both decide to escape from the place. Their attempt is a failure and Heurtevent, unable to get over what he considers a return to hell, commits suicide. But rebellious Fran√ßois tries again and this time around he is successful. He finds shelter at his friend Stephanie's home...

Title: 345. Zorro, the Avenger
description: Compiled from six episodes of the original Disney Zorro series, this film has El Zorro, "The Fox," battling Jose Sebastian Varga, "The Eagle," a corrupt dictator set on taking control of all of Spanish California.

Title: 346. El hombre y el monstruo
description: A failed pianist sells his soul to the devil in return for his becoming the greatest musician in the world. The catch: every time he plays he turns into a horrible monster.

Title: 347. Ardhangini
description: At the very moment of her birth, ill-fated Chhaya's mother passes away, her dad loses his job, and their house burns down. She is shunned since then by children her age as well as their parents. Her dad brings her up with a lot of love, and even arranges her marriage with a young man, whose mother, uncle and nephew approve of Chhaya. But when the uncle finds out about Chhaya's past, they reject her. This news kills her dad, and Chhaya re-locates to live with her friend, Leela Lal, who lives a middle-class lifestyle with her husband, Murari, and her mother-in-law, who is very superstitious and never lets Leela out of her sight. Murari and Leela introduce her to Prakash, an airline pilot, and both eventually fall in love with each other. When Prakash takes her with him to meet his mom, Chhaya finds out that she is the same woman who rejected her and abruptly leaves without meeting anyone. Prakash manages to convince her to marry him despite of her background, and she does. Both go to live with Prakash's family, but Chhaya is treated as an outcast and every possible mishap is blamed on her presence. Will Chhaya's presence continue to cause problems in this household also - especially when Prakash's plane goes missing?

Title: 348. Premier Khrushchev in the USA
description: Footage of Soviet Leader Nikita Khrushchev in the USA during his 1960 visit. Which includes meeting Frank Sinatra on the set of his film Can-Can.

Title: 349. Vice Raid
description: The bosses of the prostitution racket have one of their prostitutes go to New York City to entrap a police officer and get him thrown off the force. She does as she is told but then the gangsters make a mistake.

Title: 350. Rommel ruft Kairo
description: In 1942 the Germans devised an operation to introduce in Egypt spies to provoke a rebellion against the British.

Title: 351. The Diary of a High School Bride
description: A 17-year-old high-school senior must justify her wedding to a 24-year-old law student to both her parents and her unbalanced ex-boyfriend.

Title: 352. Happy Anniversary
